intro: Lambertia fairallii, commonly known as the red lambertia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features bright red, tubular flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing a contrast to the vibrant floral display. Lambertia fairallii thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
